pullRequest.body:
This PR proves that flat is a local property.
Main results:
1. `Flat_of_localization_maximal` : Let `M` be a module over `CommRing R`. If the localization  of `M` at each maximal ideal `P` is flat over `R_p`, then `M` is flat over `R`.
2. `Flat_of_localization_finitespan` : Let `M` be a module over `CommRing R` and `S` be a set that  spans `R`. If the localization of `M` at `s : S` is flat over `Localization.Away s`,  then `M` is flat over `R`.
3. `flat_iff_localization` : Let `R_p` a localization of `CommRing R` and `M` be a module over `R_p`. Then `M` is flat over `R` if and only if `M` is flat over `R_p`

- [x] depends on: #19080 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Looks great! In my branch I've moved a lemma and fixed namespace/capitalization issues: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/flat_local...flat_local_demo?expand=1

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19080~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@chrisflav Could you please take a look and send this to maintainers if it looks good? I think I made too many changes for me to qualify.
Thanks, LGTM! I'd recommend merging master just to be safe. The increase of import in the leaf file Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Localization is reasonable.

Sorry but this is already added into Mathlib, by myself: [Localization.flat](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Flat/Localization.html#Localization.flat). See [discussions on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/116395-maths/topic/Puzzles.20around.20Picard.20group/near/480318967).

It's possible to shorten these two proofs considerably and get rid of the auxiliary defs by proving equality between the two maps $(I \otimes M)_J \to M_J$ and $(I \otimes M)_J \cong R_J \otimes (I \otimes M) \cong I\otimes (R_J\otimes M) \cong I \otimes M_J \to M_J$ (where all tensor products are over R). Please refer to [this commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/4b3bc835188889a809182c7d32c2cdff519b0046) and [this](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3788a7cea6506874b30f34fca5b24e17f77293df). I change the hypotheses to assume flatness over R, but you've already proven these are equivalent to your original statements (`flat_iff_localization`).
I only did the LocalizedModule version, and other reviewers might request a IsLocalizedModule version too.

Since you're not using LaTeX, it's better to change R_p to Râ‚š.
```suggestion
* `Flat_of_localization_maximal` : Let `M` be a module over `CommRing R`. If the localization
  of `M` at each maximal ideal `P` is flat over `R_p`, then `M` is flat over `R`.
* `Flat_of_localization_finitespan` : Let `M` be a module over `CommRing R` and `S` be a set that
  spans `R`. If the localization of `M` at each `s : S` is flat over `Localization.Away s`,
  then `M` is flat over `R`.
* `flat_iff_localization` : Let `R_p` a localization of `CommRing R` and `M` be a module over `R_p`.
  Then `M` is flat over `R` if and only if `M` is flat over `R_p`.
```
This can go to the end of Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Stability, I believe.

```suggestion
* `Module.flat_iff_localization` : Let `Râ‚š` be a localization of a commutative ring `R` and `M` be a module
  over `Râ‚š`. Then `M` is flat over `R` if and only if `M` is flat over `Râ‚š`.
```
(similarly below)

```suggestion
theorem flat_iff_flat_of_isLocalization : Flat S M â†” Flat R M :=
```
or possibly `flat_iff_of_isLocalization`.
Can we get rid of this `show`?

This gets rids of the `show`: it's just a bit long to write. The main reason it can't be a single `simp` call is there are two places where `rw [mkLinearMap_apply]` would fire, but we must control it to rewrite precisely one place for the proof to work.
```suggestion
  rw [AlgebraTensorModule.curry_apply, curry_apply, restrictScalars_apply, LinearMap.comp_apply,
    restrictScalars_apply, mkLinearMap_apply]
```
Even if its lengthy, I still prefer this over the `show`.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/LocalProperties): flatness is a local property
